page.title: 17WOODLANDS IN THE GOYTRE AREA
page.content: Woodlands in and around{GOYTRE}are a valuable landscape and wildlife resource.The conservation of the woodlands is therefore an important factor and Tree Preservation Orders are in force.There are 5 woodlands which are important in the setting of the village. {Wern Fawr:}this is an extensive area of coniferous woodland designated as Woodland/Forestry Commission land.It has a deciduous belt on the eastern edge which is privately owned. {White Gables:}5.29 acres of woodland and scrub to the south of Capel Ed Lane.{Pen-y-Wern:}an area of low lying wet,mixed deciduous woodland of 4 acres.{Goytre House:}deciduous wood of 18 to 20 acres in the grounds of Goytre House.{Lynwood Copse:}creates a visual barrier along Newtown Road, which enhances the rural character.
